summary: This document details the transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein following his arrest on July 6, 2019. It describes interactions between Epstein and the FBI agents during the transport, including inquiries about his medical needs and his treatment during the process.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of the investigation and was transported by FBI agents following his arrest.

persons.name: SA ELIZABETH
persons.context: SA ELIZABETH assisted in the transport of Epstein to the US Court House.

connections.description: Epstein was the defendant being transported by the FBI agent.
Epstein was the defendant being transported by the FBI agent.

events.title: Arrest and Transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport and transported to 26 Federal Plaza for processing.

events.title: Transport to US Court House
events.description: Epstein was transported from the US Bureau of Prisons to the US Court House for further legal proceedings.

locations: US Bureau of Prisons, MCC facility
US Court House, 500 Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport.
During transport, Epstein was asked about his medical and psychological needs and responded negatively.
Epstein was treated professionally by the FBI agents during his transport.
Two pairs of handcuffs were used for Epstein's transport for comfort.
Epstein declined food and drink offers during the transport.
